description: Single storey side and rear wrap around extension, following removal of ground floor side bay window; mansard roof extension to rear (main) roofslope; rear roof extension to rear outrigger roofslope incorporating four dormer windows to rear and side roofslopes; associated internal and external alterations, involving installation of additional windows to side elevation; and single storey detached garden outbuilding for use as an office
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title(s): 	101 Rev G - Proposed floor Plans

102 Rev G - Proposed First Floor Plans, 103 Rev G - Proposed First Floor Plans, 104 Rev G - Proposed Roof Plans, 105 Rev G - Proposed Outbuilding Floor Plans, 106 Rev G - Proposed Site Plan, 201 Rev G - Proposed Front and Rear Elevations, 202 Rev G - Proposed Side Elevations, 203 Rev G  - Proposed Outbuilding Elevations, 301 Rev G - Proposed Sections, Arboricultural Impact Assessment by Ligna Consultancy dated 9/11/2022, Arboricultural Method Statement by Ligna Consultancy dated 24/11/2022 and Assessment of Internal Sound Insulation Report dated 21/10/2022
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
| The maximum number of persons occupying the premise hereby approved shall be limited to no more than 6 people in 6 bedrooms .

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013), policy DAA of Ealing's New Local Plan (Reg 18),  policy 1.1 (e) of the Ealing Development Strategy 2026 (2012) and policies D3 and D6 of the London Plan (2021).
| No cooking facilities shall be installed at any time in any of the rooms. All cooking and preparation of hot food shall take place within the communal kitchen (as per approved plans).

Reason: To ensure that the rooms are not wholly self-contained and to protect the amenity of the occupants of each of the rooms and neighbouring properties, in accordance with Policy D6 of the London Plan, Policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD and policy DAA of Ealing's New Local Plan (Reg.18)
| The proposed cycle parking structure (6 spaces) in the rear garden shown on the approved plans shall be implemented in full prior to occupation of the property and retained thereafter.

Reason: To promote more sustainable forms of transportation, in accordance with National Planning Policy Framework 2021 - section 9, Policy T5 of the London Plan and Ealing's Sustainable Transport Strategy 2019.

| Notwithstanding the approved plans, refuse/recycling storage shall be provided in accordance with Council policies and brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained thereafter, as shown on the approved plans.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, to protect amenity of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013, policy 1.1(e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and policies SI7 and SI8 of the London Plan (2021).

| The window/s inserted in the side elevations shall be obscure glazed and non-opening (where openable parts less than 1.7m above floor) unless otherwise confirmed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To safeguard neighbouring amenity from light pollution in accordance with policy DAA of Ealing's New Local Plan (Reg.18), policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013) and policy D6 of the London Plan (2021).
| No part of the roof of the building shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.
Reason: To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policy DAA of Ealing's New Local Plan (Reg.18)

,policies D4 and D6 of The London Plan (2021), polices 7.4, 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and polices 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 the Ealing Core Strategy (2012). | The proposed rooflights hereby approved shall not project more than 150mm from the roof plane and retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To minimise light spillage and interference with the privacy and outlook of adjoining occupiers and in the interests of good neighbourliness and in accordance with policy DAA of Ealing's New Local Plan (Reg.18) and policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013).

| The detached rear outbuilding shall only be used for purposes incidental to the enjoyment of the development hereby approved, and shall not be used for habitable accommodation, as an independent dwelling or any industrial, commercial or business use.

Reason: To ensure that the development does not detract from the amenity of the adjoining properties, and to enable the Local Planning Authority to retain control over the use of the building in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy DAA of Ealing's New Local Plan (Reg.18), policies D3 & D6 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) - section 12.
| No kitchen facilities shall be installed in the outbuilding at any time.

Reason: To prevent the creation of a separate self-contained residential unit of accommodation in the interests of the living conditions of the existing and future residents of the site and to ensure that the use of the building does not, by reason of any other activity, harm the living conditions in the area, in accordance with policies 1.1,1.2 & 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012) and Policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), Policy DAA of Ealing's New Local Plan (Reg.18)
Policies D3 and D6 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) - section 12.

| No trees, shrubs or hedges within the site which are shown to be retained on the approved plans shall be felled, uprooted, wilfully damaged or destroyed, cut back in any way or removed without previous written consent of the Local Planning Authority.

Any shrubs or hedges removed without consent or dying or being severely damaged or becoming seriously diseased within 5 years from the completion of the development hereby permitted shall be replaced with shrubs or hedge plants or similar species capable of achieving a comparable size unless the Local Planning Authority gives written consent to any variation.

Any trees removed without consent or dying or being severely damaged or becoming seriously diseased within 5 years from the completion of the development hereby permitted shall be replaced in accordance with trees, shrubs or hedge plants of similar size and species unless the Local Planning Authority gives written consent to any variation.

Reason: To secure the protection throughout the time that development is being carried out, of trees, shrubs and hedges growing within the site which are of amenity value to the area in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policy 5.10 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy G5 of Ealing's New Local Plan (Reg.18), policy G5 of the London Plan (2021), Ealing Trees SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) - section 15.

| The sound insulation of the floor/ceiling /wall structures separating different types of rooms/ uses, namely, communal hallway and bathrooms adjoining bedrooms, should be enhanced by at least 5dB above the recommended Building Regulations value. The assessment and mitigation measures shall be based on standards and noise limits of the Council's SPG10 and BS8233:2014. The approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance National Planning Practice framework 2021 - section 2 and 12 and Standard 30 of the Housing SPG (GLA),  policies D4, D6 and D13 of the London Plan (2021), policies 1.1 (g) and (h) of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy, policy Ealing Local Variation of London Plan Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan and Ealing's New Local Plan (REg.18) policy DAA
